alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Gibson; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 9:16AM CDT until August 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Obion River near Obion For the Obion River...including Obion...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Obion River near Obion. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Several secondary roads and large areas of farmland are flooded in northern Dyer County. Flooding is occurring around Rives in southeast Obion County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 35.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 35.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
